entry.title: Bitcoin Flash Crashes: If Bulls Fail, BTC May Plunge To $40,000
entry.summary:
Bitcoin is falling. Earlier today, the coin crashed to as low as $49,000, a 30% dip from July highs. Even though the coin has briefly retraced, peeling off some losses, the downtrend remains, at least from the candlestick formation in the daily chart. The sharp sell-off of Bitcoin is weighing on the altcoin and crypto markets. At press time, the total crypto market cap, according to CoinMarketCap, is down 15.46% to roughly $1.82 trillion.
Bitcoin At A Precarious Level: Bears Might Force Prices To $40,000
Although the uptrend remains from a top-down preview, one analyst thinks there will be more blood in the coming days if sellers press on.
Taking to X and citing on-chain developments, the analyst noted that since the coin recently dipped 12% lower than the on-chain trader realized…

entry.summary:
The Shiba Inu community has launched a petition urging Binance, the world’s largest crypto exchange, to burn SHIB tokens. The petition, which has received an overwhelming response from SHIB supporters, has successfully crossed its first milestone, amassing over 1,000 votes.
Shiba Inu Petition Crosses 1,000 Votes
The Shiba Inu community has taken significant bold steps in its efforts to boost the value of SHIB. On July 17, 2024, the community started a petition, requesting Binance to implement a daily burn mechanism for 1% of all SHIB token transactions.
The Binance petition has garnered a significant amount of support from various community members, exceeding its first milestone by reaching 1,164 votes in just a few weeks. The petition is also nearing 90% of its goal, with just 1…

entry.title: Here’s How Many Bitcoin Holders Are Left In Profit After Crash
entry.summary:
On-chain data reveals what percentage of the entire Bitcoin userbase is still carrying a profit following the latest crash in the asset’s price.
Bitcoin Has This Many Addresses Still Holding Net Gains
In a new post on X, the market intelligence platform IntoTheBlock has discussed about the profit-loss status of the Bitcoin investors after the crash that the cryptocurrency has seen.
The indicator of interest here is the “Historical In/Out of the Money,” which uses on-chain data to determine the percentage breakdown of addresses on the network that are carrying profits and losses.
This metric works by going through the transaction history of each address on the network to find the average price at which it purchased its coins. If this cost basis for any address is less than the ass…

entry.title: Australian Federal Police Targets 2,000 Crypto Wallets In Nationwide Sweep—Here’s How
entry.summary:
According to a recent report, the Australian Federal Police (AFP) has launched an “in-depth” investigation into several phishing scams that have compromised about 2,000 crypto wallets belonging to residents in Australia. The revelation follows an in-thorough investigation by Chainalysis dubbed “Operation Spincaster,” which brought these security breaches to light.
The report noted:
The joint activity, known as Operation Spincaster, targeted criminals using a tactic called ‘approval phishing’, which has been used to steal more than $4 billion in cryptocurrency from unsuspecting victims globally since May 2021.
Notably, approval phishing, the method used in these scams, involves deceiving individuals into authorizing transactions that ultimately grant the scammer access to transfer th…

entry.title: Bitcoin Fear and Greed Index Hits Near Extreme Fear: A Buying Opportunity?
entry.summary:
The latest data from Bitcoin Magazine Pro's Fear and Greed Index reveals that Bitcoin sentiment has dropped to a near "extreme fear" level, scoring 26 out of 100. Historically, such a low score suggests a potential buying opportunity for savvy investors, as market sentiment indicates undervaluation and widespread caution.
The Fear and Greed Index is a tool for assessing market sentiment, analyzing factors like volatility, momentum, social media trends, and Bitcoin's dominance over other cryptocurrencies. To help investors gauge when to buy or sell Bitcoin, the index ranges from: 0-24: Extreme fear (red) 25-46: Fear (amber) 46-49: Neutral (yellow) 50-74: Greed (light green) 75-100: Extreme greed (green) Bitcoin's current score of 26 reflects heightened market anxiety, coinciding with a recent -25% price drop for Bitcoin this week. Despite this, historical trends suggest that periods of extreme fear often precede price rebounds, making it an opportune moment for strategic investments. The index has been a reliable indicator, showing that excessive fear typically signals undervalued conditions, whereas extreme greed may indicate overvaluation. The consistent tracking of fear and greed levels can potentially provide valuable insights, allowing investors to navigate the volatile Bitcoin market more effectively. As the Bitcoin market continues to evolve, tools like the Fear and Greed Index remain essential for understanding market dynamics and making informed investment choices. For more detailed information, insights, and to sign up for a free trial to access Bitcoin Magazine Pro's data and analytics, visit the official website here.

entry.title: Vitalik Buterin Offloads Shiba Inu Themed Memecoin Post Airdrop
entry.summary:
Ethereum co-founder Vitalik Buterin offloaded his entire holdings of Neiro tokens, a Shiba Inu themed memecoin. The move came shortly after the Neiro project team airdropped 17.145 billion tokens to his Ethereum address, making him the temporary largest holder of the coin. This amount represented about 4% of the total supply of Neiro, valued at approximately $130,000 at the time of the transfer.
Buterin Dumps Shiba Inu Themed Memecoin
According to real-time transaction data from Lookonchain, Buterin converted his holdings into Ethereum, netting 44.53 ETH, equivalent to roughly $112,500. The analytics provider detailed the transaction on X, stating, “Vitalik Buterin sold all 17.15B Neiro for 44.53 ETH ($112.5K) 1 hour ago. The Neiro team transferred 17.15B Neiro (4.08% of the total supp…

entry.title: FOMO HOUR 164 - ETH ETF DAY!
entry.summary: BTC ETF Flows: +$534m. ETH outperforms slightly as 9 ETFs set to launch. Grayscale moves $1bn ETH to Coinbase for outflows. Biggest BlackRock ETF inflow day in 4 months. Mt Gox moves $2.8bn BTC for distributions. US government moves $4m BTC to Coinbase. Bedford FC buys $4.5m BTC. Hamilton Lane launches private credit fund on SOL. CNBC discusses BTC reserve currency rumour. Polymarket sets another trading record. BlockFi administrator submits plan to repay customers. WLD denies insider trading and manipulation claims. India keeps high crypto taxes unchanged. Gate exchange exits Japan. Marathon Digital fined $138m for breaching NDA. HyperLend launches lending on HyperLiquid.

entry.title: Mika Shares How to Sell Crypto Using Kraken Wallet
entry.summary: Rug Radio creator Mika guides you through the process of selling crypto and transferring it back to your bank account.

entry.title: FOMO HOUR 163 - JOEVER FOR BYEDEN
entry.summary: Crypto dips then bounces on Biden-Harris switch. SOL again leads, DEX volume eclipses ETH + BNB. Biden news had led to $67m liquidations. Democrats have chance to ‘regain crypto vote’. Mt Gox transfers to Bitstamp expected soon. Crypto sees $3.2bn fund inflows in 3 weeks. China company Boyaa buys $100m BTC. Polymarket saw $80m bets on Biden withdrawal. Polymarket 2024 volumes hit $500m. Elon appearance at Bitcoin Nashville rumoured. Combined SOL, BTC & ETH ETF coming: Geraci. Call skew heads to 2024 extremes in bullish sign. Plan B points to bullish setup in S2F model. Coinbase premium moves back to positive. Gensler likely resigns next year: 10x. Germany already lost $124m profit selling.

entry.title: What's the Meta? Do Crypto Degens Care About Being Scammed?
entry.summary: What's the Meta? With the rise of Pumpdotfun and rug pulls becoming a daily occurrence, why do crypto degens keep investing? Do these investors enjoy being scammed? It appears that people very often invest in meme coins that are very obviously going to rug pull. Once it happens, they just laugh it off on Twitter, is being scammed fun?!

entry.title: FOMO HOUR 162 - SOLANA LEADS THE CHARGE!
entry.summary: BTC ETF Inflows: +$85m. SOL leads majors ahead of ETH ETF. Rumours Trump may want BTC in strategic reserve. Trump BTC round-table tickets going for $845k. Polymarket hits volume record of $20m. ETH ETFs will get steady capital: Binance CEO. Winklevii donate $1m to try and unseat Warren. Tornado sees $1.9bn volume resurgence. New overlay attacks growing in crypto. Messari co-founder faces backlash on views. Raydium integrates with Moonpay. Tencent leads investment round in Chainbase. ZA Bank partners with stablecoin issuers.

entry.title: FOMO HOUR 161 - THE BIG WIF COMEBACK?
entry.summary: BTC ETF Inflows: +$53m. Crypto remains stable despite macro sell-off. ETH ETF providers undercut each other on fees. Grayscale keeps 2.5% high fee, launches mini-fund. Grayscale launches ‘Decentralised AI Fund’. Dimon may be ‘changing tune’ on Bitcoin. Many alts now bounced 50-90% from lows. Vote implies 55% of Mt. Gox depositors won’t sell. BlockFi to make creditor distributions this month. WazirX exchanges sees $230m suspected breach. Vitalik warns against voting ‘pro-crypto’. Vitalik & Autism Capital trade barbs. Bitcoin Magazine to hold pro-Trump fundraiser. State Street explore blockchain payments. UPbit sees 44% monthly drop in volume.

entry.title: FOMO HOUR 160 - CHATTING TO ROBINHOOD!
entry.summary: BTC ETF Inflows: +$423m. Crypto pushes higher, biggest ETF inflow in 6 weeks. Mt. Gox FUD ‘overestimated’ as whales accumulate. Kraken to begin Mt. Gox repayments in 7-14d. ETH spot ETFs will push ETH to $5k: Bitwise. SOL ETF will be next: Bloomberg. XRP up 35% this week ahead of potential settlement. Aethir reports $36m H1 customer revenue. Craig Wright now under threat of perjury & forgery. FTX & CFTC in $12.7bn settlement. WLD up 40% after delaying unlock schedule. Helio announces instant crypto fiat commerce. Phantom pauses cross-chain swaps amid exploit.

entry.title: FOMO HOUR 159 - MEMECOINS GO MAD!
entry.summary: BTC ETF Inflows: +$301m. BTC dips from $65k as $6bn moves from Mt. Gox. Coinbase & MicroStrategy surge with BTC. Genesis sells another $38m BTC. ETH ETF timeline delayed until July 23rd. Trump chooses crypto friendly Vance as VP. Old clip shows Vance bashing Gensler on crypto. Bitcoin is good during debasement: Larry Fink. Michael Dell calls Fink video ‘fascinating’. Fear & Greed index shifts to Greed. Tether mints $1bn USDT on Tron. Stripe expands crypto integration to the EU.

entry.title: FOMO HOUR 158 - A WILD WEEKEND FOR BITCOIN
entry.summary: Trump response optimism takes BTC to $63K. Bitcoin whales accumulate most since April 2023. Trump still set to talk at Bitcoin Nashville. ETH ETF approval this week: Geraci. XRP vs SEC press conference rumoured on 18th. Crypto funds saw $1.44B inflows last week. Rumours China is to ‘unban BTC’ in Q4. S. Korea may delay crypto taxes until 2028. Russia to allow crypto trading on stock exchange. All altcoin categories outperform BTC over 7d. BitConnect infamous promoter convicted. Scroll becomes 8th L2 with TVL over $1bn. ETHFI Season 2 claims available this week. Base hits record 1m UserOps in a week.
